meanings.definition: A type of lipid molecule consisting of two fatty acid chains attached to a glycerol molecule.
meanings.sent1: Diglycerides are important molecules in our bodies for storing energy.
meanings.sent2: The diglycerides found in the cell membrane help maintain its structure.
meanings.sent3: When the diglycerides threw a party with the glycerol, everyone had a great time bonding.
meanings.sent4: The diglycerides acted like loyal friends, always sticking together through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the diglycerides appeared like tiny building blocks holding everything together.

meanings.definition: An emulsifier commonly used in food products to improve texture and shelf life.
meanings.sent1: The bakery used diglycerides to make their bread softer and last longer.
meanings.sent2: Diglycerides are added to salad dressings to prevent separation of oil and vinegar.
meanings.sent3: The diglycerides in the kitchen pantry were known for their talent in blending ingredients seamlessly.
meanings.sent4: Her cooking secret was using diglycerides to magically combine flavors in her dishes.
meanings.sent5: The chef's special sauce owed its creamy texture to the addition of diglycerides.
